page.title: 04AN ECOLOGICAL PARADISE
page.content: Assynt is well known for its rich and varied ecological environment bordering on a Nature Reserve. Some of the things it is possible to find are Sea Otters in the bay, Golden Eagles and Peregrine Falcons round our mountains, Wild-cats and Badgers in our woods. Mountain Aven, Oyster Plants, the Guelden Rose and many different orchids are all to be found growing here. Our Rivers & Lochs have Salmon & Sea and Brown Trout in them. The Minch boasts a rich & varied Fishing ground. Our Hills support the Red & Sika Deer. Although it is an ecological wonderland, there are problems arising with pollution & human greed. The Salmon have been over-fished & our shoreline polluted. There is shortly to be a survey into possible acid-rain contamination of our Lochs & Woods.
